intro: Pavetta bagshawei var. leucosphaera, commonly known as the white-sphere pavetta, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests.
